    Show / Hide Table of Contents

    Class ViewModelCommon

    Base class recommended to use for view models across the application. Encapsulates implementations of System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged and System.ComponentModel.INotifyDataErrorInfo.

    Inheritance
    System.Object
    ViewModelCommon
    ViewModel
    Implements
    IViewModelCommon
    System.ComponentModel.INotifyDataErrorInfo
    IProgressReporterCommon
    System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged

    System.Object.ToString()
    Namespace: BionicCode.Utilities.Net.Common.ViewModel
    Assembly: BionicCode.Utilities.Net.Common.dll
    Syntax
    public abstract class ViewModelCommon : IViewModelCommon, INotifyDataErrorInfo, IProgressReporterCommon, INotifyPropertyChanged

    DisableIndterminateMode

    Constant representing value of System.Double.NegativeInfinity. When assigned to Progress and when calling the default implementation of OnProgress(ProgressData) the value will automatically set IsIndeterminate to false.

    Declaration
    public const double DisableIndterminateMode = -Infinity
    Field Value
    Type Description
    System.Double
    | Improve this Doc View Source

    EnableIndterminateMode

    Constant representing value of System.Double.PositiveInfinity. When assigned to Progress and when calling the default implementation of OnProgress(ProgressData) the value will automatically set IsIndeterminate to true.

    Declaration
    public const double EnableIndterminateMode = Infinity
    Field Value
    Type Description
    System.Double

    CreateProgressReporterFromCurrentThread()

    Creates a System.IProgress<T> instance that is associated with the caller's thread. The registered progress callback is the virtual ViewModelCommon.OnProgress(ProgressData) member.

    Declaration
    public IProgress<ProgressData> CreateProgressReporterFromCurrentThread()
    Returns
    Type Description
    System.IProgress<ProgressData>

    A System.IProgress<T> instance that posts progress to the thread CreateProgressReporterFromCurrentThread() was called from.
    Remarks

    To create a System.IProgress<T> instance that is associated with the application's primary dispatcher thread, for example to update proerties that bind to a DispatcherObject, call .

    | Improve this Doc View Source

    Returns
    Type Description

    An System.Collections.IEnumerable containing all error messages of the specified property.
    Remarks

    If the propertyName is null all current error messages will be returned.

    OnProgress(ProgressData)

    When overridden, handles the System.IProgress`1.Report(`0) that is invoked by the System.IProgress<T> instance returned from CreateProgressReporterFromCurrentThread(). Can be used as progress delegate for any System.IProgress<T>.

    Declaration
    protected virtual void OnProgress(ProgressData progress)
    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    ProgressData progress

    The progress argument.
    Remarks

    The default implementation provides the followwing logic: a value of System.Double.NegativeInfinity or DisableIndterminateMode will automatically set the IsIndeterminate property to false. A value of System.Double.PositiveInfinity or EnableIndterminateMode will automatically set the IsIndeterminate property to true.

    | Improve this Doc View Source

    TrySetValue<TValue>(TValue, ref TValue, Boolean, IEqualityComparer<TValue>, String)

    Generic property setter. Sets the value of any property of the extending view model by passing in a the corresponding property backing field. Automatically raises the System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged.PropertyChanged event for this property.

    Declaration
    protected virtual bool TrySetValue<TValue>(TValue value, ref TValue targetBackingField, bool isRejectEqualValuesEnabled = true, IEqualityComparer<TValue> equalityComparer = null, string propertyName = null)
    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    TValue value

    The new property value.
    TValue targetBackingField

    The backing field of the target property for the new value. Passed in by reference using ref keyword.
    System.Boolean isRejectEqualValuesEnabled

    Default: true. Default: true. Enable equality check before setting the value to avoid raising the System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged.PropertyChanged event on equality. Set to false to always raise the System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged.PropertyChanged event.
    System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer<TValue> equalityComparer

    A System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer<T> to check for value equality. If this optional parameter is not provided System.Object.ReferenceEquals(System.Object, System.Object) will be used.
    System.String propertyName

    The name of the property that changes. By default the property name is automatically set to the property that called this setter method.
    Returns
    Type Description
    System.Boolean

    true when the property has changed or false when equality checking is enabled and the new property equals the old property value.
    Type Parameters
    Name Description
    TValue

    The generic type parameter of the new property value.
    Remarks

    If equality checking is enabled by setting the isRejectEqualValuesEnabled parameter to true and the new value equals the old value, then the System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged.PropertyChanged event won't be raised. If equality checking is enabled and no System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer<T> was provided by setting the equalityComparer parameter, the method will check for reference equality using System.Object.ReferenceEquals(System.Object, System.Object).

    | Improve this Doc View Source

    TrySetValue<TValue>(TValue, Func<TValue, (Boolean IsValid, IEnumerable<Object> ErrorMessages)>, ref TValue, Boolean, Boolean, Boolean, IEqualityComparer<TValue>, String)

    Sets the value of the referenced property and executes a validation delegate.

    Declaration
    protected virtual bool TrySetValue<TValue>(TValue value, Func<TValue, (bool IsValid, IEnumerable<object> ErrorMessages)> validationDelegate, ref TValue targetBackingField, bool isRejectInvalidValueEnabled = false, bool isThrowExceptionOnValidationErrorEnabled = false, bool isRejectEqualValuesEnabled = true, IEqualityComparer<TValue> equalityComparer = null, string propertyName = null)
    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    TValue value

    The new value which is to be set to the property.
    System.Func<TValue, System.ValueTuple<System.Boolean, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.Object>>> validationDelegate

    The callback that is used to validate the new value.
    TValue targetBackingField

    The reference to the backing field.
    System.Boolean isRejectInvalidValueEnabled

    When true the invalid value is not stored to the backing field.
    Use this to ensure that the view model in a valid state.
    System.Boolean isThrowExceptionOnValidationErrorEnabled

    Enable throwing an System.ArgumentException if validation failed. Use this when ValidatesOnExceptions on a Binding is set to true
    System.Boolean isRejectEqualValuesEnabled

    Default: true. Enable equality check before setting the value to avoid raising the System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged.PropertyChanged event on equality. Set to false to always raise the System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged.PropertyChanged event.
    System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer<TValue> equalityComparer

    A System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer<T> to check for value equality. If this optional parameter is not provided System.Object.ReferenceEquals(System.Object, System.Object) will be used.
    System.String propertyName

    The name of the property to set. Default name is the property that called this method.
    Returns
    Type Description
    System.Boolean

    Returns true if the new value doesn't equal the old value and the new value is valid. Returns false if the new value equals the old value or the validation has failed.
    Type Parameters
    Name Description
    TValue

    The generic value type parameter
    Remarks

    This property setter supports invalid value rejection, which means values are only assigned to the backing field if they are valid which is when the validationDelegate return true.
    To support visual validation error feed back and proper behavior in TwoWay binding scenarios,
    it is recommended to set isThrowExceptionOnValidationErrorEnabled to true and set the validation mode of the binding to Binding.ValidatesOnExceptions.
    If not doing so, the binding target will clear the new value and show the last valid value instead.
    If equality checking is enabled by setting the isRejectEqualValuesEnabled parameter to true (the parameter defaults to trur) and the new value equals the old value, then the System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged.PropertyChanged event won't be raised. If equality checking is enabled and no System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer<T> was provided by setting the equalityComparer parameter, the method will check for reference equality using System.Object.ReferenceEquals(System.Object, System.Object).

    Exceptions
    Type Condition
    System.ArgumentException

    Thrown if isThrowExceptionOnValidationErrorEnabled is set to true and validation failed
    | Improve this Doc View Source

    TrySetValueSilent<TValue>(TValue, ref TValue, Boolean, IEqualityComparer<TValue>, String)

    Generic property setter. Silently sets the value of any property of the extending view model by passing in a the corresponding property backing field. Suppresses a System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged.PropertyChanged event for this property.

    Declaration
    protected virtual bool TrySetValueSilent<TValue>(TValue value, ref TValue targetBackingField, bool isRejectEqualValuesEnabled = true, IEqualityComparer<TValue> equalityComparer = null, string propertyName = null)
    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    TValue value

    The new property value.
    TValue targetBackingField

    The backing field of the target property for the new value. Passed in by reference using ref keyword.
    System.Boolean isRejectEqualValuesEnabled

    Default: true. Default: true. Enable equality check before setting the value to avoid raising the System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged.PropertyChanged event on equality. Set to false to always raise the System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged.PropertyChanged event.
    System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer<TValue> equalityComparer

    A System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer<T> to check for value equality. If this optional parameter is not provided System.Object.ReferenceEquals(System.Object, System.Object) will be used.
    System.String propertyName

    The name of the property that changes. By default the property name is automatically set to the property that called this setter method.
    Returns
    Type Description
    System.Boolean

    true when the property has changed or false when the property value didn't change (e.g. on equality of old and new value).
    Type Parameters
    Name Description
    TValue

    The generic type parameter of the new property value.
    Remarks

    If equality checking is enabled by setting the isRejectEqualValuesEnabled parameter to true and the new value equals the old value, then the System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged.PropertyChanged event won't be raised. If equality checking is enabled and no System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer<T> was provided by setting the equalityComparer parameter, the method will check for reference equality using System.Object.ReferenceEquals(System.Object, System.Object).

    | Improve this Doc View Source

    TrySetValueSilent<TValue>(TValue, Func<TValue, (Boolean IsValid, IEnumerable<Object> ErrorMessages)>, ref TValue, Boolean, Boolean, Boolean, IEqualityComparer<TValue>, String)

    Silently sets the value of the referenced property without raising System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged.PropertyChanged and executes a validation delegate.

    Declaration
    protected virtual bool TrySetValueSilent<TValue>(TValue value, Func<TValue, (bool IsValid, IEnumerable<object> ErrorMessages)> validationDelegate, ref TValue targetBackingField, bool isRejectInvalidValueEnabled = false, bool isThrowExceptionOnValidationErrorEnabled = false, bool isRejectEqualValuesEnabled = true, IEqualityComparer<TValue> equalityComparer = null, string propertyName = null)
    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    TValue value

    The new value which is to be set to the property.
    System.Func<TValue, System.ValueTuple<System.Boolean, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.Object>>> validationDelegate

    The callback that is used to validate the new value.
    TValue targetBackingField

    The reference to the backing field.
    System.Boolean isRejectInvalidValueEnabled

    When true the invalid value is not stored to the backing field.
    Use this to ensure that the view model in a valid state.
    System.Boolean isThrowExceptionOnValidationErrorEnabled

    Enable throwing an System.ArgumentException if validation failed. Use this when ValidatesOnExceptions on a Binding is set to true
    System.Boolean isRejectEqualValuesEnabled

    Default: true. Default: true. Enable equality check before setting the value to avoid raising the System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged.PropertyChanged event on equality. Set to false to always raise the System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged.PropertyChanged event.
    System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer<TValue> equalityComparer

    A System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer<T> to check for value equality. If this optional parameter is not provided System.Object.ReferenceEquals(System.Object, System.Object) will be used.
    System.String propertyName

    The name of the property to set. Default name is the property that called this method.
    Returns
    Type Description
    System.Boolean

    Returns true if the new value doesn't equal the old value and the new value is valid. Returns false if the new value equals the old value or the validation has failed.
    Type Parameters
    Name Description
    TValue

    The generic value type parameter
    Remarks

    This property setter supports invalid value rejection, which means values are only assigned to the backing field if they are valid which is when the validationDelegate return true.
    To support visual validation error feed back and proper behavior in TwoWay binding scenarios,
    it is recommended to set isThrowExceptionOnValidationErrorEnabled to true and set the validation mode of the binding to Binding.ValidatesOnExceptions.
    If not doing so, the binding target will clear the new value and show the last valid value instead.
    If equality checking is enabled by setting the isRejectEqualValuesEnabled parameter to true and the new value equals the old value, then the System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged.PropertyChanged event won't be raised. If equality checking is enabled and no System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer<T> was provided by setting the equalityComparer parameter, the method will check for reference equality using System.Object.ReferenceEquals(System.Object, System.Object).

    Exceptions
    Type Condition
    System.ArgumentException

    Thrown on validation failed
